name: Linked List
description: A linked list is a linear data structure where elements are connected via pointers, allowing dynamic allocation and efficient insertions/deletions.

name: Backtracking
description: Backtracking is a recursive algorithmic approach that systematically explores all possible solutions to a problem and backtracks when necessary.

name: Binary Search
description: Binary search is a divide-and-conquer algorithm that efficiently locates a target in a sorted array, halving the search space iteratively.

name: Two-Pointers
description: The Two-pointer algorithm involves using two pointers to traverse a data structure, often solving problems like finding pairs or detecting cycles.

name: Map
description: A Map data structure stores key-value pairs, facilitating efficient retrieval and storage, akin to a dictionary or associative array in programming.

name: Graph
description: A Graph data structure comprises nodes and edges to represent relationships. It's a versatile model for complex connections and networks.

name: As Easy As Pi
description: Pi (Ï€) is an irrational mathematical constant representing the ratio of a circle's circumference to its diameter (approximately 3.14159).
